txt.en:
'Welcome, welcome! This is quite an odd event, don't you think? To race around on these great tall beasts -- I am not sure I like it at all! But folk come from near and far to take a chance on this game and prove their skill with a steed.

'The rules are very simple -- race through each gate, and you mustn't fall off your steed before the time runs out. When you see two gates next to one another, you must choose which path to take, be it high or low. The low path may be muddy, and the high is sure to be dry, but precarious indeed. There will be other hurdles to disrupt you as well.

'Do you feel up for this challenge? Only the most spirited riders should even attempt such a feat! It is sure to be very dangerous. I myself would never attempt such a thing!'
'I have never seen such excellent riding in these parts, [placeholder]! I am very impressed. Well done indeed!'

Your steed is slowed by a sticky mire....
You gain a burst of speed for your agile navigation
You have lost the race

The Festival Run is a fairly new tradition in the Delving Fields of the Shire. Many challenges have been laid down to present a tricky course for the brave riders of Middle-earth who wish to demonstrate their mettle on horseback.\n\n<rgb=#FF0000> NOTE: This quest will be removed from your quest log when the event it is associated with ends. </rgb>
You have lost the race

Race to the fifth gate

The festival steeds can be found spoiling for the race near the stable at the Delving Fields Festival race-track.\n\nYou should mount a steed to begin the race -- a pony if you are shorter in stature, or a horse if you are of a taller build.

'So you are going to try your hand at racing, are you? You are braver than I, friend! The horses and ponies await you at the starting line, just there.'

The Delving Fields Fall Festival Run
Carl Proudfoot stands next to the finish line at the race-track in the Delving Fields.\n\nYou should speak with Carl Proudfoot and inform him of your success.
